metadata.name: Glasgow Science Centre & Tower
metadata.description:
A reflective view of the Glasgow Science Centre and Tower at Pacific Quay across a glass like River Clyde. 

The Science Tower is the tallest fully rotating freestanding structure in the world and holds a Guinness World Record as the whole structure is capable of rotating 360 degrees.

The PS Waverley, the last seagoing passenger-carrying paddle steamer in the world, is also moored to the dock at the base of the Science Tower.
